Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The assembly history of galaxies is one of the most important open questions in modern astrophysics, and it has become studied extensively using deep surveys at different wavelengths (e.g., optical/near-infrared).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we present an analysis of the stellar mass assembly for a sample of more than 100 000 massive galaxies selected from the VVDS-02h field observed with the VIMOS spectrograph on board of the Very Large Telescope between 0 < z < 5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use a novel technique based on the combination of photometric redshifts and spectral energy distribution fitting to derive accurate estimates of galaxy masses over such large redshift range.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the evolution of the average stellar mass density can been described by two main phases: i) a rapid increase up to z ~ 2 followed by ii) a slower growth phase until today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behaviour is consistent to previous studies but our data allow us to study in detail how the build-up of stellar mass proceeds as a function of galaxy properties like colour or morphology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider a spherically symmetric solution of Einstein's equations in five dimensions with an extra dimension compactified on S 1 /Z 2 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The bulk is assumed to be empty, while matter fields are confined to our four-dimensional world (the "brane").

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this model can explain the observed flatness of galactic rotation curves without introducing any new particles or exotic forms of energy density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we show how the mass distribution within galaxies may arise naturally as a consequence of the geometry of space-time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is supported by NSF grant PHY-0456728.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 PACS numbers: 04.20.-q, 11.10.-z, 98.80.Cq

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A fundamental question about the nature of dark matter has been if it consists of one or more species of particle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If so, what are their masses?

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 What interactions did they have with ordinary matter?

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 How much dark matter did each galaxy contain?

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These questions motivate us to study models for which the dark matter is described by some field theory living on a higher dimensional spacetime manifold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we will focus on a class of solutions where the extra dimension was compactified on a circle $S^1$. Such configurations are first studied in [1] , where it is shown that if the fifth dimension is small compared to the other length scales involved then the gravitational potential felt by observers on the brane is indistinguishable from that produced by a point-like source located at the center of the sphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, when the size in the extra dimension becomes comparable to the radius of curvature of the brane, the gravitational force law changes dramatically [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In [3] , Randall and Sundrum showed that such a configuration could provide a natural explanation for the hierarchy between the weak scale and the Planck scale.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They considered a 5D anti-de-Sitter space with two 3-branes embedded along its boundary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of these branes represents our universe, while the second acts like a mirror image of ours.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Matter fields are localized near either brane, but gravity propagates freely throughout the entire bulk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have investigated whether pulsar timing observations can be used to detect gravitational waves by observing the Shapiro effect, which was caused by the passage of gravitational waves through space-time around the Earth and its companion star (the Sun).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this method will not work with current technology because it requires very accurate measurements of pulse arrival times over many years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we show how future radio telescopes could make such measurements if they were equipped with new technologies like phased-array feeds or digital backends.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we discuss other possible methods using pulsar timing data to search for gravitational waves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Gravitational waves cause time delays between pulses emitted at different points on the surface of a rotating neutron star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These time delays depend on the distance between these points as well as their position relative to the line-of-sight towards the observer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most prominent effects occur when the wave passes close by the Earth and its companion stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This causes an additional delay known as the Shapiro effect

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If one knows the positions of all pulsars within a globular cluster, then one can use the observed pulse arrival times to measure the distances between them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By comparing these measured distances with those predicted by general relativity, one can test whether Einstein's theory correctly describes gravity on large scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The measurement is performed at the Cyclotrons and Accelerators Laboratory (CYCLONE) in JINR, Dubna using the proton beam with energy E = 1 GeV.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experiment was carried out to study the pion production in nuclear reactions induced by relativistic protons on nuclei Ta(p, π+).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experimental setup included two scintillation counters S1 and S2 with registration of particles emitted into forward hemisphere, three plastic scintillator detectors S3-S5 for measuring the angular distribution of secondary particles produced in the reaction under investigation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results obtained were compared with calculations based on the model developed earlier [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Introduction  Pion production is one of the most important processes in hadronic interactions which play an essential role in many fields such as astrophysics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , cosmic ray physics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , accelerator technology

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we present new data on the pion production in nuclear collisions induced by relativistic protons interacting with nuclei Ta(p,π + ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These measurements were performed at CYCLONE laboratory in JINR-Dubna [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Experimental Setup

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experimental setup used in our experiments consisted of:  -two scintillation counters S1 and S2; -three plastic scintillator detectors; -a set of collimators; -the target made of natural tantalum foil 0.1 mm thick placed between the first pair of scintillation counters; -the trigger system consisting of four scintillation counters T1-T4.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The layout of the experimental setup is shown schematically in Fig.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main parameters of the detector system is listed in Table I .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The signals from all detectors are recorded by means of CAMAC modules [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an analytical approach to study the dynamics of the contact process on complex networks with arbitrary degree distributions, including scale-free (SF) ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method is based on super-critical series expansions around the epidemic threshold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this technique allows one to obtain accurate results even when the network size N becomes very large.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we find that the SF exponent has only a weak effect on the critical behavior at the transition point.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that the universality class of the phase transition does not depend on the details of the underlying topology but rather it depends solely on its average connectivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, our analysis shows that the presence of quenched randomness can lead to significant deviations from mean-field predictions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I. INTRODUCTORY REMARK The contact process

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , which describes the spreading of infectious diseases or computer viruses [2] , plays a central role in many areas of physics ranging from statistical mechanics [3] to epidemiology [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also represents a paradigmatic model for studying self-organized criticality [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there have been several attempts [6] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [8] aimed at extending the original formulation of the contact process by adding some ingredients such as spatial structure [9] , aging [10] , memory [11] , and heterogeneities

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These extensions are motivated by the fact that real-world systems often exhibit non-trivial topological features

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [13] and/or they evolve with time [14] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite these efforts, the exact solution of the contact process remains elusive [15] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, new techniques [16] - [18] were developed to tackle analytically problems related to the contact process on complex topologies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For them, the so-called super-critical series expansion [19] provides a powerful tool to investigate the properties of the system close to the epidemic threshold

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Indeed, using this approach, it was possible to derive closed-form expressions for the probability distribution function [21] and the first two moments

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [22] of the number of infected nodes in the steady state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, it allowed us to determine the scaling laws characterizing the relaxation of equilibrium

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the thermal effects from rotation on random classical zero-point radiation (ZPR) by using the canonical ensemble method and the Wigner distribution function.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that, for an isolated system with angular momentum J = 0, there is no temperature effect due to ZPR; however, when J > 0, the rotational energy increases as T4 at high temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result agrees well to previous studies based on quantum mechanics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we show that the total entropy S(T ) decreases monotonically with increasing temperature T .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are also compared with those obtained via the density matrix formalism.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some possible applications of our findings.

 [1] , has become studied extensively over many years

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It describes the vacuum fluctuations of electromagnetic fields

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, it has attracted renewed interest because of its potential application in various areas such as astrophysics

 [7] , condensed matter physics

 In this work, we consider the thermal effects of rotation induced by ZPR on an isolated system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The gamma ray emission in the energy range 100 MeV to 10 GeV was studied using data taken by EGRET on board CGRO during its first four years of operation (1991) (1992) (1993) (1994) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The analysis was was performed for two different regions, one centered at l = 0° and b = - 5° , which includes the galactic centre region, and another centered at l = 180° and b = + 5° .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In both cases we have used an iterative maximum likelihood method to determine the fluxes of individual sources as well as their spectral parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there are three distinct components contributing to the observed gamma-ray flux above 1 GeV :  A diffuse component with a power law spectrum extending upto ~10 GeV .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A point source located at Sgr A* with a power law spectrum .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An extended source near the galactic center with a broken power law spectrum .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also present results obtained when the same analysis was repeated after excluding the contribution due to the central part of the Galaxy .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the electrical excitation of nonlinear waves in a 2D channel with an applied voltage bias between two parallel metal plates separated by a dielectric layer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that, depending on the parameters of the system (the thickness of the dielectric layer, the density of electrons), different types of nonlinear waves can be excited.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that for certain values of these parameters solitary wave solutions exist which are similar to those found earlier in 1D systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The existence of such solitary waves was confirmed experimentally using time-resolved optical reflectivity measurements performed at room temperature on samples consisting of GaAs/AlGaAs quantum wells grown by molecular beam epitaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These experiments reveal the presence of bright solitary waves propagating along the direction perpendicular to the applied electric field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their propagation velocities agree well to theoretical predictions based on numerical simulations of the underlying equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results presented here may have important applications in semiconductor devices where it has was shown recently that the generation of solitary waves leads to improved performance characteristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A slide-o-cam transmission is an alternative to conventional geared transmissions in which the input and output shafts are connected by means of cams that rotate on their own axes, with no gears or other mechanical elements between them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main advantages of this type of transmission are:  •

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 No backlash owing to tooth meshing; • High efficiency (up to 98%); • Low noise levels; • Reduced weight and volume compared to traditional gearboxes; • Easy assembly and disassembly; • Possibility of using different types of motors as inputs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article presents some strategies for designing a slide-o-cam transmission based on the analysis of its kinematic characteristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These strategies have been applied to develop two prototypes of slide-o-cam transmissions intended for use in electric vehicles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, a mathematical model has been developed to simulate the behavior of these transmissions under various operating conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, experimental tests are carried out to validate both the design process proposed here and the results obtained through simulation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results from our analysis of the effects of cosmic rays on galaxy clusters, using cosmological hydrodynamic simulations with and without CRs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the presence of CRs leads to an increase in gas temperature at large radii (r > 0.5Rvir) due to adiabatic compression of the ICM during cluster formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The effect is more pronounced at higher values of the initial magnetic field strength.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find that there are significant differences between the radial profiles of X-ray surface brightness obtained with and without CRs which can be used as observational signatures of their presence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we show that the inclusion of CRs has little impact on the global properties such as total mass or luminosity but does affect the distribution of metals within the cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is supported by NASA grant NAG5-9998.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Cosmological hydrodynamical simulations were performed using Enzo developed by the Laboratory for Computational Astrophysics at the University of California, San Diego.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this thesis, we study power control problems in cellular mobile radio systems with code division multiple access (CDMA).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider the uplink scenario where each user transmits to its base station using an orthogonal spreading sequence and all users share the same frequency band.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The objective is to minimize the total transmit power subject of individual quality-of-service constraints at each user's receiver.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On order to obtain tractable results, we make use of tools from stochastic geometry which allow us to model the locations of both mobiles and interferers as point processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our main contributions are summarized below.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, we derive closed-form expressions of the outage probability when the number of active users grows without bound.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These expressions can be used to determine how many users can simultaneously communicate reliably over the network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Second, we propose distributed power control schemes that achieve these limits asymptotically under certain conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Third, we develop centralized power control algorithms that guarantee performance close to optimality even if only partial information about the channel gains or interference levels is available.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present simulation results and our theoretical findings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The calibration and data products for GALEX are described in this document, which is intended to be used by astronomers who wish to use these data sets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main focus of this document is on describing how to obtain calibrated images (i.e., fluxes) from raw data files produced by GALEX's instruments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This includes information about the photometric response function as well as corrections that must be applied to the raw data before it can be analyzed further.   .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A description of the calibration and data products for the GALEX mission is presented here.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These data have been released publicly through the Multimission Archive at Space Telescope Science Institute (MAST).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The primary goal of this document is to describe how to obtain calibrated imaging data from the raw data files produced by the GALEX detectors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we provide details regarding the photometric response functions and other corrections necessary to produce accurate results when analyzing the data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Fullerenes are spherical molecules composed entirely of sp2-hybridized carbons, which can become arranged in different ways to form various allotropes with unique properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most common is the C60 molecule (buckminsterfullerene), but other forms such as nanotubes or graphene have also become reported.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Fullerenes was first discovered by Kroto et al., who received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1996 for their work on them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this study we report on the growth mechanism and structural characterization of novel carbon-based nanomaterials that consist of an amorphous network of interconnected nanoparticles resembling fullerenes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These structures grow spontaneously when evaporating carbon atoms on silicon substrates at temperatures between 600-700 °C under ultrahigh vacuum conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how these new carbon nanostructures exhibit remarkable mechanical properties of high elasticity and hardness combined with low friction coefficients making them ideal candidates for use as protective coatings against wear and corrosion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an algorithm of consistent hypothesis testing in which we consider all possible hypotheses that are compatible with some given set of observations, and select those that maximize their posterior probability according to Bayes' theorem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this can been done efficiently by using dynamic programming techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting algorithm is optimal up to constant factors under certain conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our approach also allows us to reason consistently across multiple experiments performed sequentially or simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem has become studied extensively in statistics but only recently in artificial intelligence (AI).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In AI it was first considered as part of the PAC learning framework where one seeks algorithms that learn concepts from examples while making few mistakes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, these approaches do not provide any guarantees when there exists more than one concept that fits the data equally well.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast our method provides provable guarantees even if several hypotheses fit the data equally well.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we demonstrate the practicality of our approach through two applications:  1)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A new algorithm for finding explanations in probabilistic databases; 2) An improved algorithm for identifying protein families based on sequence alignment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of our analysis on the time-averaged spectrum and light curve of GRB 090902B, which is one of the brightest bursts ever detected by Fermi/GBM (Gamma-ray Burst Monitor).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that its average spectrum can be well fitted with two blackbody functions plus an additional power-law component at high energies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The temperature of each blackbody function decreases as the emission radius increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior is consistent to theoretical predictions for photospheric emission from relativistic outflows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to this thermal component, we also detect non-thermal emission above 100 MeV.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our spectral fitting suggests that there are three distinct physical regions contributing to the observed gamma-rays: 1) A photosphere-like region producing thermal radiation; 2) An internal shock region generating nonthermal radiation; 3) A magnetized wind region responsible for high-energy photons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings provide new insights in the physics of GRBs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Black body, Photon index, Power law

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the statistical properties of Barkhausen noise generated by an Ising spin system with random fields and competing interactions at its surface, using wavelets to analyze the time series produced by this model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the power spectrum of the Barkhausen signal becomes well described by a stretched exponential function over several decades in frequency space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The stretching exponent depends on both temperature T and magnetic field H. In particular, we show how the stretching exponent can been used as a measure of the degree of disorder in the sample under investigation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible extensions to our work to other types of systems exhibiting avalanche dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Barkhausen noise (BN) has been studied extensively since it was first observed experimentally more than 100 years ago [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It consists of bursts of magnetization reversals which occur when a ferromagnetic material is driven through successive metastable states

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , and are believed to play an important role in determining the coercive force of such materials [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The statistics of BN has attracted considerable interest recently [4] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [8] due to their potential application in non-destructive testing [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite many experimental studies [10] - [12] there are still open questions about the origin of these fluctuations [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, although some authors claim that they arise from thermally activated processes [14] others argue that they result from collective effects [15] or even quantum tunneling [16] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of theoretical models [17] - [20] have also be proposed to explain the physics behind BN but none of them seems able to reproduce all features simultaneously [21] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the spectrum statistics of random matrices with entries given by the sum over all paths in an infinite tree, which is obtained as a limit of finite rank deformations of large Wigner matrices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that for any fixed number of particles there exists a sequence of such deformations converging to the limiting matrix whose spectral properties are described by the Tracy-Widom distribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular we prove universality of this distribution for the case when the number of particles tends to infinity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results presented here generalize those known previously only from the Gaussian ensembles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is supported by Russian Science Foundation grant 14-50-00040.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The problem of statistical description of the energy levels of complex quantum systems has been studied extensively during last decades (see e.g., [1] ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It turns out that many important features of these spectra can be understood within Random Matrix Theory (RMT)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 RMT deals with the statistical analysis of the eigenvalue distributions of various families of random matrices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of the most popular models considered for RMT is the so-called Wigner ensemble [3] , where one considers N ×N Hermitian matrices H = H † with independent identically distributed elements h ij having mean zero and variance 1/N .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if the probability density function p(h) of each element h ij decays fast enough at |h| → ∞ then it follows from the standard arguments

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [4] that the empirical measure µ N of the normalized eigenvectors of H converges weakly almost surely to some deterministic probability measure µ on the unit circle T = {z ∈ C : |z| = 1} called circular law.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, with additional assumptions about the decay rate of p(h), the Stieltjes transform m N (z) := E TrH − z −1 of µ N converges pointwise almost surely to the Stieltjes transform M (z) of µ [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years much attention has become paid to the investigation of the local behavior of the spectrum near its edge

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it turned out [9] that the fluctuation statistics of the largest eigenvalues λ max

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have studied the scaling behavior of two different types of surfaces, one made out of pyrex glass (a transparent material) and another made out of silicon dioxide (SiO2), which is an opaque material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SiO2 surface was prepared by etching in hydrofluoric acid to remove all traces of metal contamination that could be present on its surface after being cut from a wafer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Both surfaces are then cleaned using standard cleaning procedures before they were subjected to particle bombardment at room temperature under ultra-high vacuum conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that both surfaces exhibit similar scaling behaviors when we plot their respective roughness as a function of the number of deposited atoms per unit area for various incident angles ranging between 0°and 60°.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there are some differences observed in the scaling exponents obtained for these two surfaces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that the scaling behavior of these surfaces may not depend solely on the chemical composition but also depends strongly on other factors such as the microstructure of the substrate materials used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results from our investigation into accretion disk continuum emission in black hole candidates (BHCs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have developed an analytical model for calculating the spectrum emitted by a thin, optically thick accretion disk around a Schwarzschild black hole and applied it to several BHCs with known mass functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed spectra is well reproduced when we assume that the inner edge of the disk is located at 6 gravitational radii.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that the standard thin disk model can been used as a good approximation for modeling the X-ray continuum emission of these objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Black holes -- Spectroscopy -- X-rays -- Modeling -- Accretion disks -- Emission lines -- Broad-band spectral energy distribution -- Luminosity function -- Mass measurement -- Stellar-mass black holes -- Supermassive black holes -- Active galactic nuclei -- Quasars -- Cosmic evolution         1 Introduction     Over recent years has have been considerable progress made towards understanding the physical processes occurring near supermassive black holes (SMBH) in active galactic nuclei (AGN), quasars, and other similar systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These studies rely upon observations of the broad-band spectral energy distributions (SEDs) of SMBHs over many decades in frequency space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, due of their enormous distances, direct measurements of the intrinsic luminosities of most AGNs are not possible.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead, one may use indirect methods such as reverberation mapping or statistical correlations between various properties of AGNs to determine their luminosities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if one knows how much light passes through some region of interest within an AGN then one may calculate its luminosity using simple geometric arguments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Alternatively, if one knows the distance to an AGN then one could measure its absolute magnitude directly.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unfortunately, both of these approaches require detailed knowledge about the structure of the emitting regions which cannot currently be obtained observationally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, with order to make accurate estimates of the luminosities of distant AGNs, one needs to develop models capable of reproducing the observed SEDs of nearby AGNs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report the observation of dynamic condensation of water vapor on crack tips during slow fracture experiments performed under vacuum conditions (10-6 mbar) and low temperature (77 K).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The condensed water is found to be localized along the crack front, where it forms a thin film that covers the entire surface of the crack tip.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This phenomenon has been observed for cracks propagating both perpendicularly and parallel to the direction of maximum tensile stress.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose a model based on molecular dynamics simulations which explains this effect by considering the presence of an electric field generated by the moving crack tip.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we show how the formation of such films will affect the mechanical properties of the material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Condensation phenomena are ubiquitous in nature but have rarely been reported in materials science.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we present experimental evidence showing that water condenses on the crack surfaces when they propagate through fused silica glasses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results were obtained using a combination of optical microscopy techniques with environmental scanning electron microscopy (ESEM), Raman spectroscopy and infrared reflection absorption spectroscopy (IRAS).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The author considers an alternative approach to classical electrodynamics, which is based on the concept of "pre-metricity" introduced by Einstein in his work "On the Electrodynamics of Moving Bodies" (1905).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea behind this approach consists in introducing into consideration

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 not only the usual electromagnetic field tensor Fμν

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 but also its dual counterpart *

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On order to obtain equations for both fields simultaneously one has to introduce additional terms into Lagrangian density L(Fμν ,*Fμν ) that are quadratic with respect to derivatives of these fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It turns out that such modified Lagrangian leads to the following set of equations:  where  is the d'Alembert operator,  is the energy-momentum tensor of matter fields, and  is the current four-vector describing the flow of electric charge.

 In addition to the standard Maxwell's equations, Eqs.

 (1)-(3), there appears another equation -the so-called "duality condition":

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an approach to the description of macroscopic configurations in terms of quantum states, which was based on the concept of entanglement entropy and its generalization for mixed states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this representation allows one to obtain exact results for some statistical properties of systems with many degrees of freedom.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we consider the problem of calculating the partition function of classical spin models at high temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method can be used as a basis for constructing approximate algorithms for solving problems related to the calculation of thermodynamic characteristics of complex systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main goal in statistical mechanics is to describe the behavior of macroscopic objects (for example, gases) by using microscopic information about their constituents (atoms).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This task becomes especially difficult when dealing with large systems consisting of many particles or spins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For such cases, it is necessary to use approximations, since direct calculations are impossible due to the exponential growth of the number of possible microstates with increasing system size N .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of these approaches is the so-called mean-field approximation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , according to which each particle interacts only with all other particles simultaneously; i.e., the interaction between different pairs of particles is neglected.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, even in this simplified model, the calculation of the partition function Z = Tr exp(−βH) (1) remains extremely complicated [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years, there has been growing interest in developing new methods for describing macroscopic configurations in terms similar to those used in quantum physics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These studies were inspired by the fact that both classical and quantum descriptions have certain common features

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [9] : they are formulated in terms of wave functions ψ(x), where x denotes either positions of particles or spins, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, the evolution of these wave functions obeys the same Schrödinger equation ih∂ t |ψ(t)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 = H|ψ(t) , where H is a corresponding Hamiltonian operator.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It should also be noted that the density matrix ρ = |ψ(t) ψ(t)| plays the role of a probability distribution in both theories [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The segmentation clock is an oscillatory gene regulatory network that controls the periodic formation of segments in vertebrates, such as vertebrae and ribs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The aim in this paper is to investigate how the presence of quenched impurities affects the statistical properties of the order-parameter fluctuations close to a continuous phase transition point.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our main interest will be focused on the so-called "random fixed-points" (RFP)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , i.e., those points where the renormalization-group flow of an effective field theory describing the effect of disorder stops because it becomes unstable against small perturbations [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In general RFPs do not correspond to any physical situation since they represent singularities of the RG flows; however there exist some cases where such singularity appears only after many orders of perturbation expansion have been resummed [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if the disorder distribution has a finite variance then the corresponding RFP corresponds to a stable fixed point [4] ; therefore its effects should appear only beyond all orders in perturbation theory [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, if the disorder distribution is broad enough so that its moments diverge, then the RFP represents a genuine non-perturbative phenomenon

 We discuss the concept of particle number in quantum mechanics, with particular emphasis on its role as an indicator for quantum indistinguishability between particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this is not always true by considering two examples where it did not hold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first example involves fermions which are distinguishable but have different spin states; we argue that these should be considered to belong to distinct species rather than being regarded as identical particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In our second example, we consider bosons which can occupy the same state (e.g., photons) but are nevertheless distinguishable; here too they do not constitute a single species.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present arguments for identifying particle number with entropy or information content.

 Horizontal Gene Transfer (HGT) is an important evolutionary force that can increase genetic diversity and accelerate evolution, but it also has negative effects such as disrupting co-adapted gene complexes or introducing deleterious mutations into recipient genomes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through this study we investigate how HGT affects the mean fitness of unicells evolving under different environmental conditions using computational models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that HGT increases the mean fitness when cells were exposed to fluctuating environments with high levels of stressful events.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if there are only mild fluctuations then HGT decreases the mean fitness because it introduces harmful mutations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, for constant environments without any external stresses, HGT does not affect the mean fitness at all.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that HGT may have played an important role during early stages of life's evolution by increasing its adaptability to changing environments.

 Introduction     Supermassive black holes (SBHs), with masses ranging from $10^{6}$ to $10^{10}$ solar mass, reside at the center of most galaxies

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They have been found to exist in pairs or even clusters [2] , indicating that SBHs grow through multiple merger events [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through these processes, SBHs lose their angular momenta due to gravitational radiation emission [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, they will eventually merge into one single object [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The final stage of the merger process involves two spinning BHs orbiting each other [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Due to strong gravitational fields near the horizon, the Kerr metric [7] should be used instead of general relativity [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, since the orbits of merging BHs are highly eccentric [9] , the effects of higher-order corrections to the Kerr solution become important [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These corrections include both post-Newtonian [11] terms and those arising in quantum gravity

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been shown that the inclusion of these corrections leads to precession of the orbital planes

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if the initial spin vectors of the two BHs lie along the same axis but point opposite directions, then the orbital plane will precess around the total angular momentum vector [14] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the initial spin axes were not aligned with the total angular momentum vector, then the orbital plane may undergo several complete rotations

 We study the obfuscation complexity of planar graphs, which are defined as the minimum number of edges that need to be removed in order for an adversary not to be able to distinguish between two isomorphic copies of the graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this problem can be solved by solving a linear program with O(n) variables and constraints (where n denotes the number of vertices), or equivalently by finding the maximum matching on a bipartite graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This yields a polynomial time algorithm for computing the obfuscation complexity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a corollary we obtain a lower bound on the obfuscation complexity for any n-vertex tree T .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we prove that there are infinitely many trees whose obfuscation complexities equal their numbers of leaves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The obfuscation complexity of a graph G = (V , E ) was defined as the smallest integer k such that removing at most k edges from G makes it indistinguishable from another graph G' = (V ', E').

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In other words, if an attacker has access only to the set of all possible subgraphs induced by some subset S ⊆ V × V then he cannot tell whether he is looking at G or G' unless |S| > k .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we consider the case where G is a planar graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It turns out that in this setting one can solve the obfuscation complexity problem efficiently using combinatorial techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More precisely, our main result shows how to compute the obfuscation complexity exactly via solving a linear program with polynomially many variables and constraints.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a consequence of our results we get a new lower bound on the obfuscatability of trees.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, we provide examples showing that the obfuscation complexity may differ significantly from the size of the largest independent set.

 We study the decoherence of macroscopic quantum superposition states in open systems, and show that it is possible to prepare such states with high fidelity using current experimental techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider two different types of macroscopic superposition: coherent spin states (CSS) and Schrödinger cat states (SCS).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For CSS we find that the decay rate scales as $1/N$ where $N$ is the number of particles involved in the state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This scaling law can be understood by considering the effect of spontaneous emission on each particle separately.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast for SCS the decay rate scales as $1/sqrt(N)$ which cannot be explained by treating individual particles independently.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead we argue that this behavior arises due to collective effects between all particles in the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how these results could be tested experimentally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Decoherence of macroscopic superposition states has been studied extensively over recent years [1–3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown theoretically [4] , and confirmed experimentally [5, 6] , that macroscopic superposition states are extremely fragile against environmental noise

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main reason behind their fragility lies in the fact that they involve many particles, so even small interactions with an environment lead to rapid loss of coherence

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we focus on studying the decoherence process of macroscopic superposition in open systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Specifically, we consider two different types of superposition: coherent spin states [10] and Schrödinger cat-states [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Coherent spin states have already be prepared experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [12] while Schrödinger cat states remain elusive

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there exist proposals for preparing them

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [14–18] , and recently some progress towards realizing them has been made [19, 20] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our analysis shows that both types of superposition exhibit qualitatively similar behaviour under decoherence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One Shot Astro includes several tools which are useful for analyzing large amounts of astronomical data quickly and efficiently.

 These include one-shot-datacleaner , which performs automated quality control checks of raw data files;   one-shot-mosaic , which creates mosaicked images with multiple dithered exposures;  one-shot-astrometry , which determines astrometric solutions to individual frames or entire mosaic images;    one-shot-photometry , which measures fluxes and/or magnitudes from stars across a field-of-view;    one-shot-pipeline , which automates the process of running these various tasks together into a pipeline;    one-shot-wikimapia , which allows users to create custom sky maps based on their own catalogs of objects.

 We present an analysis of chemical equilibrium and disequilibrium processes occurring in the atmospheres of substellar mass objects (SMBOs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have developed a new method for calculating departures from chemical equilibrium, which are based on the assumption that all species are in local thermodynamic equilibrium with each other at any given point within the atmosphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach allows us to calculate the abundances for individual molecular species as functions of altitude above the photosphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that there can be significant deviations from chemical equilibrium even under conditions where the gas temperature is much higher than the dust temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that carbon monoxide may be depleted by several orders of magnitude relative to its abundance predicted by chemical equilibrium models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggest that SMBO observations should take into account possible non-equilibrium effects when interpreting their spectra.

 We present the results of multiepoch radial velocity (RV) observations for four late-type M dwarfs and three brown dwarf candidates with spectral types ranging between M3V-M8V, obtained using the High Accuracy Radial velocity Planet Searcher (HARPS).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find no evidence for RV variability in any of these targets at levels greater than ~1 m/s over timescales up to several years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results are consistent with previous studies that have found little or no evidence for giant planets around low-mass stars and substellar objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The lack of detectable RV variations is likely due to the small masses and/or radii of the companions expected if they exist.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we cannot rule out the possibility that some of our targets harbor terrestrial mass planets on orbits with periods longer than those probed by our current data set.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an extension to the classical lubrication theory that accounts for shear thinning effects on both the fluid viscosity and the friction coefficient, which are assumed to be functions of local pressure only.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting model is applied to study the effect of non-Newtonian rheology on the elastohydrodynamic (EHD) behavior of a circular contact between two elastic solids with different surface roughnesses under pure rolling conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that the maximum value of the dimensionless pressure increases significantly when the fluids exhibit strong shear thinning characteristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, it should been noted that the proposed theoretical framework may also be used to investigate other important phenomena such as thermal effects or mixed lubrication regimes.

 1 Introduction     In wireless communication systems, it has been well recognized that the performance of multi-user transmission depends on how the available resources are allocated among different users

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, when there exist multiple users sharing a common radio resource such as bandwidth or transmit power, the optimal way to allocate these resources may depend on the specific system settings [2] , e.g., if the users have equal priority [3] , what type of services they request [4] , etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, efficient resource allocation strategies should take into account all relevant factors so as to maximize overall network utility [5] .

 This is comparable to the rate expected for double neutron star mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report on the observation of sporadic meteors with Suprime-Cam attached to Subaru Telescope in August, 2004.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The total number of detected meteor events is about 12000 and their distribution over sky agrees well with that expected for sporadic meteors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also found some interesting features such as clustering around bright stars (probably due to fragmentation) and an excess of faint meteors near the ecliptic plane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results may be useful for understanding the physical processes involved in the formation of meteoroid streams.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Meteor shower, Suprime-Cam, Subaru telescope, Spacecraft debris         Received September 30, 2005 Accepted December 16, 2005 Published January 31, 2006 Online publication date: February 3, 2006     We have observed sporadic meteors using Suprime-Cam mounted at the Cassegrain focus of the 8-meter Subaru Telescope in August 2004 when the Perseid meteor shower was active.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 About 12 000 meteor events were detected by our program which automatically detects moving objects in images taken every 20 seconds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their spatial distribution shows good agreement to that predicted theoretically for sporadic meteors based on orbital elements obtained from radar observations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Some interesting features are also seen; e.g., clustering around bright stars probably caused by fragmentation or an excess of faint meteoroids near the ecliptic.

 In this work, we present the design and analysis of space-time block codes (STBC) based on extended clifford algebras.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed STBC is constructed by using an orthogonal basis for the underlying algebra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that our code has full diversity order with respect to quasi-static Rayleigh fading channels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, it achieves maximum coding gain of all other known algebraic STBCs in terms of minimum determinant criterion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we provide simulation results which demonstrate the performance gains achieved with the proposed scheme compared to existing schemes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Index Terms -Space time block codes, Algebraic coding theory, Quasi-static Rayleigh faded channel, Minimum determinant criterion.

 I. INTRODUCTIO N Space Time Block Codes (STBC), introduced by Alamouti

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , are widely used in wireless communications due to their simple structure and high data rate [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there have been many efforts devoted towards designing new classes of STBCs [3] - [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main goal behind these designs was to achieve higher spectral efficiency while maintaining good error performances under different transmission conditions such as multipath propagation or frequency selective fading [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most of the existing works focus only on achieving better error performances without considering the effect of hardware limitations [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This motivates us to develop a class of STBCs which can are implemented efficiently at low complexity [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [15] , Finite Ring

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [17] etc., can also been represented by certain types of non-commutative rings called Clifford algebras

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These representations allow one to construct various signal constellations [19] , modulation techniques [20] , and communication systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Motivated by these facts, in [22] , we presented a novel construction of STBCs based on representation of Clifford algebras.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown that the proposed STBC provides significant improvement in bit error rates (BER) when compared to conventional STBCs [23] .

 We present new observations of the distant galaxy cluster RX J1117.4+07431, which were discovered in the ROSAT All-Sky Survey data by Voges et al. (1999) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The cluster was located at redshift z = 0.485 ± 0.001 with an estimated mass M500 = 1.7 × 1013 h-1M⊙ within r500 = 2.1h-1Mpc .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have obtained deep optical images using Suprime-Cam on Subaru telescope to study its member galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we observed this cluster with Chandra ACIS-I for about 50 ks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results are as follows:  -The color-magnitude diagram shows that there exists a red sequence of early-type galaxies down to our limiting magnitude RAB=25 mag.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -From the photometric redshift analysis, we find that the number density profile of the member galaxies follows well the NFW model prediction up to 3 virial radii.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -The temperature map derived from the Chandra observation reveals two hot spots near the center of the cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These features may be associated with shock heating due to merging activity between sub-clusters or groups.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The fitting problem is one of the most important problems in cosmology, which has been studied for more than 50 years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main goal of this work was to study the effect of different types of initial conditions on the evolution of density perturbations in an expanding universe with a positive cosmological constant (dark energy).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have used two methods to solve numerically the Einstein equations coupled to the matter fields:  the standard method based on the expansion of the metric tensor into spherical harmonics; and the new method developed by us that uses the expansion of the metric into Chebyshev polynomials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In both cases we have considered three types of initial conditions: Gaussian random fields generated using the Zel'dovich approximation, Gaussian random fields generated using a fast Fourier transform algorithm, and white noise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that all these models give similar predictions at late times when they are evolved up to z = 0.5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there are some differences between them at early times.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These differences can be explained as follows:  the Zel'dovich model predicts larger fluctuations compared to other models because it does not take into account the pressure term in the fluid equation; the white noise model gives smaller fluctuations due to its statistical properties; finally, the Gaussian random fields obtained via the fast Fourier transform algorithm predict intermediate values.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result shows that the choice of the initial conditions may affect significantly the final value of the power spectrum of primordial density fluctuations predicted by inflationary theories.

 The authors have studied the growth rate and its fluctuations for different types of human cancer cells grown under controlled conditions, using an automated image analysis system to measure their size over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that there is considerable variation between individual clones within each type of cell line as well as between different types of cell lines.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that it may be possible to use this information to classify tumours into subtypes with distinct biological properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, they find evidence that the growth rates were correlated across generations of daughter cells, which could provide insight into how these correlations arise during tumorigenesis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, by comparing the growth characteristics of normal and transformed cells, they conclude that transformation leads to increased heterogeneity among daughter cells.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Cancer is characterized by uncontrolled proliferation of abnormal cells.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Understanding the mechanisms underlying this process could help us develop new treatments against cancer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, studying the dynamics of cancerous cell populations has been challenging because of difficulties associated with tracking large numbers of single cells simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report our recent work in characterizing the growth behavior of thousands of individual cancer cells growing in culture dishes [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We used an automated imaging system to track the sizes in hundreds of thousands of cells belonging to several different types of human cancer cell lines ( Figure 1 ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results reveal significant differences in both average growth rates and growth fluctuations between different types of cell lines: some grow faster than others while also exhibiting larger fluctuations around their mean values [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that the growth rates were highly variable even when measured at the level of individual clones derived from a common parent population

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , suggesting that the observed phenotypic diversity might reflect genetic or epigenetic variations present in the original parental population

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggest that it should be possible to use such measurements to classify tumors into subtypes based on their growth characteristics [5] .

 We study the weighted complexity function W(G) for graphs G with n vertices, which is defined as the minimum number of edges in any n-vertex subgraph H such that H contains all cycles of length at most k (k = 3, .,n).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We prove upper bounds on this function by using the concept of the determinant of an adjacency matrix A associated to G. In particular we show that if A has no zero rows or columns then W(G) <= 2n-1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This bound can be improved when A satisfies some additional conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we give examples of how our results are sharp.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The weighted complexity function W(G;k)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (k=3,.,n), introduced by Chartrand et al., measures the minimum number of edges needed to make every cycle of length up to k in a given graph G. It is shown recently that W(G;3)=n-2 for any connected triangle-free planar graph G.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this note we improve these results by proving that W(G;3))<=n-1 for any connected triangle-free plane graph G.

 In this work, we investigate the trade-offs among processing gains and timing jitters for impulse radio ultra-wideband (IR-UWB) systems with different pulse shapes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We first derive closed-form expressions to calculate the bit error rate (BER), which is used as performance measure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, after using these results, we analyze how the BER changes according to various system parameters such as signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), number of pulses per symbol, and timing jitter variance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, numerical examples are provided to verify our analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main contributions of this study can be summarized as:  1 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Derivation of closed-form expression for calculating the BER.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Analysis of the effect of timing jitter on IR-UWB systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Numerical verification for analytical results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years, there has been growing interest in developing high data-rate wireless communication systems that operate over unlicensed bands

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , especially those based on impulse radio ultrawideband (IR-UWB:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Compared to conventional narrowband systems, IR-UWB systems have several advantages including low power consumption [3] , immunity against multipath fading [4] , and high security [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, one major drawback of IR-UWB systems is their vulnerability to timing jitter [6] - [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem arises because the received signals may experience time delays due to channel dispersion or clock imperfections at both transmitter and receiver sides [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, the transmitted symbols cannot be recovered correctly if they arrive out of phase [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, it is important to understand the effects on timing jitter on the performance of IR-UWB systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To address this issue, many studies have investigated the impact of timing jitter on various aspects of IR-UWB systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, in [13] , the authors analyzed the effect of timing jitters on the energy efficiency of IR-UWB systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They showed that the energy efficiency decreases when the timing jitter increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Also, at [14] , the authors studied the relationship between timing jitter and bit error probability (BEP).

 The electromagnetic properties of high-temperature superconductors is studied in terms of two different theoretical approaches, namely the slave-boson theory (SBT) and the doped carrier theory (DCT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SBT was based on an effective low-energy description of strongly correlated electrons by means of auxiliary bosonic degrees of freedom which represent collective charge excitations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this approach we calculate the optical conductivity as well as the Hall coefficient for various values of doping concentration

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that both quantities exhibit nontrivial temperature dependence at low temperatures T .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, within DCT these physical observables can been calculated analytically using simple expressions valid only at zero temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that there exists significant quantitative difference between predictions made by these two models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discrepancy may serve to discriminate between them experimentally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 High-temperature superconductivity has been one of the most challenging problems in condensed matter physics over past decades [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 After enormous experimental efforts [2] , its microscopic origin remains unknown.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of competing theoretical scenarios have be proposed [3] but none of them could provide a complete explanation of all available data [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it is suggested [5] that the mechanism responsible for high-temperature superconductivity might involve strong electron correlations

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These effects cannot be described within conventional Fermi-liquid theory [7, 8] because they lead to non-Fermi liquid behavior [9] such as power-law dependences of thermodynamic functions [10] or unusual transport phenomena

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To account for these features theoretically, several phenomenological models are developed [12] including the so-called slave-boson theory [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It describes the dynamics for strongly interacting fermions with spin S = 1/2 coupled to an additional set of bosonic fields representing collective charge fluctuations [14] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within this framework, the ground state of the system corresponds to a Bose-Einstein condensation [15] of the bosons

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a result, the fermionic quasiparticles acquire finite masses

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [17] leading towards their disappearance above some critical temperature [18] .

 We present an analysis on galaxy morphologies, luminosities and environments for galaxies in the Abell 901;902 supercluster (z = 0.18) using data obtained with the Wide Field Imager on board the European Southern Observatory's Very Large Telescope.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the fraction of early-type galaxies increases strongly towards higher local densities within this supercluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The morphological mix is also found to depend significantly on absolute magnitude; fainter galaxies are more likely to be late-types than brighter ones at fixed density.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that both environmental effects and internal processes play important roles in shaping the observed morphology-density relation.

 We present new near-infrared photometry for the open cluster Westerlund 1, which was located in the Galactic bulge at a distance of 8 kpc (projected).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the red giant branch tip lies at K = 12.6 mag, corresponding to an age of about 10 Gyrs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main sequence turn-off point occurs around K = 14.5 mag, indicating an age between 5 and 7 Gyrs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This places it among the oldest open clusters known.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using our data we derive a mean metallicity [Fe/H] = -1.3 ± 0.1 dex.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this value and using theoretical models we estimate the mass of the most massive star in the cluster as Mmax = 120 - 140M⊙.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we have obtained deep optical images with HST/ACS/WFC2 covering the central region of the cluster.

 These reveal several dozen very bright stars at a radius of only 20 arcsec.

 We present the set of equations describing the process of transient enhanced diffusion (TED) in shallow implanted layers, which is important to understand and control dopant profiles during semiconductor device fabrication.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model takes into account both the effects of lattice damage on TED as well as the effect of interstitials generated by the implantation itself.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this simple model can explain many experimental observations including the dependence of TED on dose rate, annealing temperature, and annealing time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we use our model to predict the evolution in the dopant profile under different annealing conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Transient enhanced diffusion (TED), i.e., the redistribution of dopants after high energy implantation followed by rapid thermal annealing (RTA), has been studied extensively over the past two decades [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is now widely accepted that the main driving force behind TED are point defects created by the implantation [2] , although other mechanisms such as vacancy clustering may also play an important role [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most commonly used models for simulating TED assume that all excess interstitials produced by the implantation are immobile at room temperature

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, recent experiments have shown that some fraction of these interstitials become mobile even before RTA [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This mobility leads for additional dopant redistribution [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it is recently found that the amount of interstitials released depends strongly on the implantation dose rate

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that the current models do not fully capture the physics underlying TED.

 We present the first calculation of quark-quark scattering at next-to-leading order (NLO) accuracy within the framework of multiple parton scattering (MPI).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this process was dominated by gluons and quarks with small transverse momenta, which are produced via initial state radiation off one or both incoming hadrons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The cross section for quark-quark scattering can be written as an integral over the transverse momentum distribution of these radiated particles times their squared matrix element.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to calculate the total cross section using standard Monte Carlo techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For addition we provide analytic expressions for the differential distributions in rapidity and azimuthal angle between the outgoing quarks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results agree well to those obtained numerically.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how our formalism could be used to study MPI effects on jet production in proton-nucleus collisions.

 We report on the temporal evolution of step fluctuations under electromigration conditions in Cu(111) and Ag(111).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The experiments were performed by scanning tunneling microscopy (STM), which allows for direct observation of atomic-scale processes at surfaces.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that, during current-induced mass transport along steps, the step edges fluctuate strongly with time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These fluctuations were characterized by an exponential growth followed by saturation after about 1 hour.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to this general behavior we observe different types of fluctuations depending on the applied voltage and temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For low voltages and temperatures below 300 K, the fluctuations show a sawtooth-like shape indicating periodic changes between two states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For higher voltages or temperatures above 400 K, the fluctuations become more irregular but still exhibit some periodicity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, at high voltages and temperatures around 500 K, no regular pattern is observed anymore.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that these fluctuations can be explained as a result of competition between diffusion and drift currents.

 We have identified more than 100 thousand candidate young stellar objects (YSOs), including both Class 0/I YSOs and Classical T Tauri stars (CTTSs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 About half of these were associated with previously known star-forming regions or open clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Most of them show extended emission around their central cores which is likely to be due to circumstellar disks and/or envelopes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A large fraction of our sample shows bipolar morphology indicative of outflows driven by accretion onto the central star(s).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spatial distribution of the newly discovered YSO candidates suggests that most of the recent massive star formation has occurred within the last few million years along the spiral arms of the Galaxy.

 We present high spatial and spectral resolution observations of two IM stars, HD 163296 and MWC 480, obtained with the Submillimeter Array at 1.3 mm wavelength.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We detect several compact sources in both objects that are associated with dusty disks or envelopes surrounding these young stellar objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The disk masses derived from these systems range between 0.1 to 0.5 Msun.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find evidence for an extended component in the vicinity of HD 163296 which may be related to its outflow activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results demonstrate that even massive protoplanetary disks can form planets like our own solar system.

 The performance evaluation of object-oriented databases (OODBs) is an important issue in database research and development, but it has been difficult because there are many factors that affect their performances.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this study we propose VOODB as a generic discrete-event random simulation model for evaluating the performances of OODBs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed model can get used with any OODB system by simply changing its configuration parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have implemented our model using Visual Basic 6.0 on Windows NT 4.0 platform.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To evaluate the effectiveness of our model, we conducted experiments with two different OODB systems, O2 and ObjectStore.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experimental results show that our model provides accurate estimations of the response times of both OODB systems under various workloads.

 We present the results of the super quantum mechanics (SQM) in dimer models with free fermion boundary conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that SQM is equivalent to the usual quantum mechanics for periodic boundary condition case.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find that there are two different types of supersymmetric ground states depending on whether or not the number of particles N is even.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For odd N , the ground state has zero energy but it will not have any degeneracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, when N is even, the ground state becomes doubly degenerate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The degeneracy can be understood by using the concept of parity symmetry breaking.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we discuss how our result fits in the general framework of supersymmetry.

 We present an analysis of the fundamental physical parameters (mass, luminosity and size) for a sample of young star clusters in the nearby spiral galaxy M33 using HST/ACS data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that these objects are consistent with being gravitationally bound open clusters or associations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These observations suggest that there exists strong coupling between spin and lattice degrees of freedom in this material.
