Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it remains unclear what happens after this fuel supply runs out.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another possibility is that the black holes become dormant as the ISM becomes too hot to cool efficiently (Bower et al. 2006; Croton et al. 2006 ) until another merger event triggers renewed activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Understanding the mechanisms responsible for shutting off black-hole growth will help us understand why some galaxies have large black holes while others do not.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The radial distribution of the inner magnetospheric (IM) plasma pressure is studied by analyzing the magnetic field and particle measurements made onboard two satellites at low altitude in the equatorial plane for an intense geomagnetic storm that occurred between March 1-5, 1982 .

 The results show that there are significant differences in the IM plasma pressure profiles obtained with different satellites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, the pressure profile derived from GEOS-1 observations shows a sharp peak near L = 3 , while those inferred from ATS-6 and GEOS-2 data exhibit much broader peaks around L = 4 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These discrepancies may be due to the fact the these satellites have different orbits which sample different regions of space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was also found that the pressure profiles inferred from the three satellites agree well when they are shifted outward along the L-shell coordinate system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that the observed difference in the pressure profiles can been attributed mainly to the spatial variation of the pressure rather than temporal changes.

 We report on the detection by Fermi Large Area Telescope (LAT) of prompt emission in gamma rays with energies above 100 MeV associated with GRB 080916C, one of the brightest bursts ever detected at high energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LAT data show that this emission is highly variable and peaks within 1 s after the onset of the burst.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find no evidence of spectral evolution during the first few hundred seconds following the trigger time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A simple power law fit to the LAT spectrum yields an index of -2.2 +/-.1 over the range 100 MeV - 10 GeV.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This value is consistent with previous measurements made using Konus-Wind and AGILE satellites but differs significantly from those obtained by other instruments operating below 100 MeV.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results are inconsistent with models which predict a softening of the photon spectrum as it evolves into the X-ray band.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They also rule out scenarios where the high-energy photons originate solely by inverse Compton scattering off relativistic electrons accelerated in internal shocks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The geometry in time is the study of how space-time evolves in time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The axiom of choice states that for any collection of non-empty sets there exists at least one set which contains exactly one element from each set.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we show that if the universe has an underlying quantum structure then it follows that the geometry of time can be described by using the axiom of choice to select a single point on every trajectory through spacetime.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss some possible implications of our results for neurobiology where the quantum Zeno effect could play a role in explaining certain aspects of brain function such as consciousness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The geometry over time is the mathematical description of how space-time evolutes over time [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was first introduced into physics by Hermann Minkowski

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] who showed that the geometry of space-time could been represented by four numbers (x,y,z,t) called coordinates or co-ordinates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are related by the following equation:  x2+y2-z2-t2=(c^2)(1-(v/c))1/2   Where c represents the speed of light and v represents the velocity of the object being observed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This equation describes the relationship of distance travelled along the x-axis, y-axis, z-axis and t-axis respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if you were observing someone walking across your living room floor with their back towards you they would have a positive value for the x-axis but no values for the other three axes as they are not moving in those directions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If however you were watching them walk away from you they would have negative values for all three axes except the x-axis since they are still travelling forward in that direction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For another example consider two objects traveling side-by-side down a roadway.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They will both travel at the same speed so their velocities will be equal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if one car travels north while the other travels south they will appear to move faster than each other even though they are traveling at the same speed.

 We report on an experiment to measure the Casimir-Lifhsztz (CL) interaction between two gold-coated glass plates immersed in water at room temperature and pressure.

 The usual formulation of quantum mechanics assumes that all experiments are performed under ideal conditions where no errors occur during the preparation of states or the execution of measurements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, in practice there always exist some experimental imperfections such as decoherence due to environmental noise, imprecision in state preparations, and inaccuracy in measurements.

 [1] , open systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This means that when performing a measurement, the outcome was determined by updating our knowledge according to Bayes' theorem [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if Alice performs a measurement of spin along the x-axis on her particle, she would update her knowledge accordingly depending on what value was obtained [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since Bob also measures his particle's spin along the same axis but obtains different results, then he must perform a new measurement since his knowledge has changed [7, 8] .

 Introduction  The Catalan numbers count many combinatorial objects such as binary trees, noncrossing partitions, spanning trees, etc., see e.g.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The present work deals in another class of Catalan-like objects: triangulations of polygons (see Figure 1 ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A triangulation T of a simple polygon P is defined as follows: it consists of all edges of P together with some additional diagonals connecting pairs of vertices of P so that each interior angle of P becomes at least 90 degrees after adding these diagonals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It follows immediately because every edge belongs to one and only one diagonal of T .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an analytical model for evaluating the effect of X-ray scattering on image quality in grazing incidence X-ray telescopes (GIXTs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model was based on ray tracing and takes into account both surface roughness and bulk density fluctuations as sources of scattering.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we demonstrate how our results compare with those obtained by Monte Carlo simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we focus on the properties of the flow at large distances from the central object where it becomes supersonic and forms shocks.

 Our main goal here was to check whether these features are correctly captured by our AMR code.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that our code reproduces all known analytical solutions very well.

 We present new observations on the molecular line emission in the vicinity of the massive young open cluster Westerlund 1 (Wd-1).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data was obtained with the Atacama Submillimeter Telescope Experiment (ASTE), which is an 8 m telescope located at Pampa la Bola, Chile.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We detected strong 12CO and 13CO J = 3-2 lines of Wd-1 using the ASTE 10 GHz band receiver system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to these lines we also observed several other transitions including C18O 1-0, 2-1, and 3-2 as well as CS 7-6 and SO 2 25-26.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These observations reveal that there are two distinct components of molecular gas associated with this object; one component has relatively low excitation temperature while another shows much higher temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This latter component appears to be distributed along an arc-like structure around the central star cluster.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that the hotter component may have become heated by shocks produced during the expansion of the stellar winds and/or supernovae explosions within the open cluster.

 We study the stability properties of magnetized relativistic flows with helical symmetry, which are described by exact solutions to Einstein's field equations coupled to Maxwell's equations for an electromagnetic field that is purely electric or purely magnetic along each fluid line.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how these solutions can be constructed using the Newman-Penrose formalism and we discuss their physical interpretation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that there exist two classes of such solutions depending on whether they contain a "dynamo region" where the magnetic energy density grows exponentially fast (and thus cannot be matched onto any solution at spatial infinity) or not.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The latter class contains all known stationary axisymmetric black hole electrovacuum solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present some new results concerning the existence for time-dependent solutions describing collapsing magnetized fluids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These solutions may have interesting applications to astrophysics.

 We report the first ultrafast electron nanocrystallographic study on size-selected gold nanoparticles (AuNPs).

 The AuNPs are prepared in solution and deposited onto carbon-coated copper grids for transmission electron microscopy studies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Time-resolved pump-probe experiments with femtosecond resolution was performed at beamline U41-PGM, MAX IV Laboratory, Sweden.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We observed that the lattice expansion is anisotropic along different crystallographic directions within individual particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This observation can be explained by considering the effect of surface stress induced during particle growth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to this, we found that the lattice expansion depends strongly on the nanoparticle sizes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results are important for understanding how the properties of nanoparticles evolve as their dimensions decrease towards atomic scale.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A new technique has been developed recently which allows one to probe structural dynamics of materials down to the atomic level using ultrashort X-ray pulses

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Subsequently, photoelectrons emitted by excited atoms travel through the crystal and scatter off neighboring atoms [9] .

 Therefore, the photoelectron diffraction pattern provides higher spatial resolution compared to traditional powder methods [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As such, they offer unique opportunities to study both the growth of structures as well as the nature of dark energy driving its accelerated expansion (see e.g., Percival & White 2009 , for a review).

 We present an algorithm that efficiently creates and propagates order in spin chains with the help of geodesic paths on graphs representing the spins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The algorithm is based on the observation that, if we consider two neighboring sites as nodes of a graph, then the probability distribution over all possible states of these two sites can become represented by a weighted edge between them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how to use this representation to create ordered regions in the chain using only local information about the state of each site.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, our method allows us to find optimal configurations of the system at low temperatures (where thermal fluctuations are small) without having to explore the entire configuration space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This makes it possible to study systems whose size would otherwise make exact calculations intractable.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results demonstrate that the proposed approach provides accurate predictions even when applied to relatively short chains.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss several extensions of the presented ideas which may lead to further improvements in efficiency.

 Introduction     Many physical phenomena such as magnetism or phase transitions occur due to cooperative behavior among many interacting particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, magnetic ordering in solids occurs because individual atoms interact strongly via their magnetic moments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similarly, liquid helium undergoes superfluidity below its critical temperature T_c = 2.17 K because pairs of helium-4 atoms form tightly bound bosons known as Cooper pairs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These examples illustrate that understanding collective behavior requires studying large ensembles of interacting particles rather than single isolated ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, simulating macroscopic properties of complex systems composed of many interacting elements remains one of the most challenging problems in computational physics today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Indeed, although microscopic interactions between individual particles can often be described accurately by quantum mechanics, describing macroscopic properties of large collections of particles typically involves approximations that cannot capture subtle effects arising from correlations between different parts of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, numerical simulations of large-scale models of real-world systems are usually performed using approximate methods such as Monte Carlo sampling [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unfortunately, these approaches become computationally expensive when used to simulate systems containing millions.

 We study the cosmological evolution in modified Gauss-Bonnet gravity, which is an extension to general relativity that includes higher-order curvature corrections.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this theory can be formulated as a scalar-tensor theory with two additional degrees of freedom and we show how it fits into the Horndeski class of theories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we derive the field equations for the background universe and linear perturbations around flat space-time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting system of differential equations has be solved numerically using standard techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results indicate that the model predicts a late time accelerated expansion without introducing any new free parameters beyond those already present in Einstein's theory.

 We consider the problem for quantizing an arbitrary vector in a Grassmannian manifold to minimize its distortion under a given rate constraint, which is relevant for multi-input-multi-output (MIMO) communications systems employing feedback.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We derive upper bounds for the minimum achievable distortion as well as lower bounds on the corresponding optimal rates by using information-theoretic tools such as entropy power inequalities and data processing inequalities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the performance gap between these two bounds increases when the dimension of the underlying Grassmannian manifold grows large.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we provide numerical examples from our theoretical findings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Multi-input-multi-output communication systems were widely used in wireless networks due to their high spectral efficiency [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this context, it has been shown recently [2] , that the use of limited-rate feedback can significantly improve system performance at low signal-to-noise ratios (SNRs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, the amount of available feedback resources may be severely constrained in practice [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to reduce the required feedback overhead while maintaining good performance, one approach consists of exploiting channel state information (CSI), i.e., knowledge about the current fading coefficients, to perform joint encoding across multiple transmit antennas [4] - [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This technique, known as spatial multiplexing or beamforming, requires CSI at both transmitter and receiver sides.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since acquiring perfect CSI at the transmitter side through training-based schemes typically involves significant signaling overhead [7] , practical implementations often resort to quantized versions of the true CSI

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, there exists a trade-off between the accuracy of the transmitted signals and the amount of feedback needed to convey them [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The design for efficient transmission strategies over MIMO channels with limited feedback remains an open research area

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this model can be described by a single scalar field whose potential has three extrema corresponding to stable de Sitter solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an optimal design method to find the best occulting mask that can get used in direct imaging searches for extrasolar planets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method was based on the concept of entropy maximization, which has been widely applied in many fields such as information theory and statistical mechanics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this concept can get extended into the field of optics by introducing a new quantity called optical entropy (OE).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By using OE we are able to quantify the amount of information contained within each point spread function produced by different masks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to determine the most efficient mask shape in respect to its ability to detect faint companions around bright stars.   .

 [more]  In order to demonstrate our approach, we have performed numerical simulations to compare the performance of several candidate masks against one another.

 We present a new method to implement the effect of Active Galactic Nuclei (AGNs) on their host galaxies and surrounding intergalactic medium into hydrodynamical cosmological simulations, which are based on an analytical description of the physical processes involved.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea of our approach is that we use the observed scaling relations between black hole mass, luminosity and velocity dispersion as well as the correlation between radio loudness and Eddington ratio to predict the properties of individual AGNs at each time step during the simulation run.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then inject thermal energy or kinetic momentum to the gas particles around these objects according to their predicted luminosities and velocities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our implementation allows us to reproduce several observational results such like the M-σ relation, the fundamental plane of elliptical galaxies, the fraction of red sequence galaxies and the evolution of galaxy clustering with redshift.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition, it also leads to realistic predictions about the number density distribution of quasars and the cosmic X-ray background spectrum.

 G-protein-coupled receptors (GPCRs) are one of the largest families of cell surface proteins and play an important role in many physiological processes, including vision, olfaction, taste, hormone secretion, neurotransmission, immune response, inflammation, and cancer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The number of known human GPCR sequences has increased dramatically over recent years due to advances in genome sequencing technologies; however, only about half have been functionally characterized so far.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this study we present a novel computational method that can be used to predict the functional class of uncharacterized GPCRs based on their sequence similarity with other members within each subfamily.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our approach was based upon two key ideas: 1) We use a new adaptive strategy to select representative sequences from different subfamilies by considering both the diversity among them as well as their evolutionary relationships; 2) We develop a new scoring scheme which takes into account not only the pairwise sequence similarities but also the structural information between query and template sequences.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using our method, we were able to successfully classify more than 80% of all human GPCRs whose functions had previously been experimentally determined.

 We present the results from numerical simulations of planetary systems around binary stars, focusing on the effects of orbital migration due to tidal interaction between planets and their host star(s).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that for most initial conditions considered here (except those with very small semi-major axes), the final orbits were generally circularized by tides raised on the planet by its host star(s); this is true even if the original orbit was eccentric or inclined relative to the binary's plane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The final mass distribution of planets depends strongly on the initial semimajor axis of the planet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, when the initial semi-major axis is relatively small compared to the binary separation, the final masses can become larger than the initial ones as a result of outward migration caused by tidal friction acting at the surface of the planet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this context, successive refinement coding [4] - [6] refers to a technique whereby a base layer containing coarse quality version of the original signal is transmitted first followed by additional enhancement layers providing higher resolution and/or better fidelity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each receiver decodes its desired number in layers depending on available bandwidth and decoding capabilities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if a user wants to view a high definition television program but does not own a smart TV capable of receiving HD signals, then he will receive only the base layer corresponding to standard definition (SD), whereas his smartphone would receive both SD and HD layers.

 The rapid growth in the use and production of digital media has created an urgent need to develop new models that support long-term access, preservation, and reuse of personal archives.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we present a service model for managing personal archives based on three key concepts:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The archive was viewed as a collection of interrelated objects (e.g., documents, photos); each object becomes associated with one or more services that provide functionality such as storage, editing, sharing, etc.; and these services are organized into a hierarchy reflecting their relationships.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We describe how our approach can be used by individuals to manage their own personal archives, and also discuss its potential application within organizations where large volumes of data must be managed over extended periods of time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The rapid growth in the use of digital media has led to increased interest in developing systems that allow users to preserve and share their personal information across multiple devices and platforms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, current approaches are focused primarily on providing solutions for storing and accessing content rather than addressing issues related to preserving it over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem becomes particularly acute when dealing in collections containing thousands of items spanning several years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To address this issue, we propose a service-oriented architecture of organizing and maintaining personal archives.

 We present exact solutions to the electromagnetic field in the presence of spherical particles with arbitrary dielectric functions, including both metals and insulators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these results can be obtained by solving Maxwell's equations using an appropriate Green function approach.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting expressions are used to calculate the dispersion relations for surface plasmons (SPs) and surface phonons (SPhPs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we find that SPs exist only when the real part of the dielectric constant is negative while SPhPs exist even if it has positive values.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we compare our results with those obtained within the classical Drude model and discuss their validity limits.

 We present an analysis of helioseismic data for the angular velocity profile of the Sun, which was based on the assumption that the total angular momentum of the Sun is conserved during its evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this hypothesis leads to a good agreement between theoretical predictions and observations at all latitudes except near the poles where we observe significant deviations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The discrepancies are explained by taking into account the effects of torsional oscillations in the convective envelope of the Sun.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that these oscillations can be excited by internal magnetic fields generated by differential rotation in the radiative interior of the Sun.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This mechanism can also operate in other solar-type stars with strong surface magnetic activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For our study we use high-precision measurements of the frequency splitting of acoustic modes obtained using space-based instruments (GOLF and MDI) aboard the Solar and Heliospheric Observatory satellite.

 We present an analysis of synthetic stellar libraries used to calibrate photometric surveys, such as Gaia and LSST.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these libraries are not accurate enough for this purpose because they do not include all relevant physical processes in their models (e.g., convection).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads to systematic errors when using them to calibrate photometry or derive distances.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible improvements to current synthetic libraries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These new datasets require large efforts to get analyzed properly.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One important aspect is the calibration of photometric surveys like Gaia and LSST which will deliver precise astrometry and multi-color photometry for billions of stars across the sky.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 As example, for the distance modulus DM = 5log10(d/d_sun), where d is the true distance between us and the star and d_sun is the Sun’s distance from Earth, then a difference of 0.01 mag corresponds to a factor of 1.1 in distance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, even small uncertainties on the absolute magnitude scale translate into significant errors in inferred distances.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Standard Model (SM) is the most successful theory in particle physics, but it has some problems such as hierarchy problem and naturalness problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we will discuss spontaneous symmetry breaking which can solve these problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We could also introduce Higgs mechanism to explain how particles get their masses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we will talk about electroweak precision tests that are used to test SM predictions at high energy experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Standard Model (SM) describes all known elementary particles and interactions between them very well up to now.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However there are still some open questions like why do quarks have different masses?

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Why does the weak interaction become strong when energies increase?

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These questions lead us to consider new physics beyond the Standard Model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Spontaneous symmetry breaking occurs if a system with many symmetries becomes unstable against small perturbations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This means because even though the original Lagrangian describing the system looks symmetric under certain transformations, the ground state of the system breaks those symmetries spontaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, in quantum electrodynamics (QED), photons interact with electrons through the exchange of virtual electron-positron pairs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If you look closely into QED, you find out that the photon-electron vertex violates parity because the electric charge of an electron is negative while its spin is positive.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 But because the vacuum expectation value of the field operator for the electron vanishes, the ground state of QED preserves parity.

 We present the design and performance for an extremely low-noise, high-accuracy cryogenic mechanical oscillator based on a suspended silicon nitride membrane with integrated Josephson junctions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The device is designed to operate at temperatures below 1 K in a dilution refrigerator environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate that this system can be used as both a highly stable reference frequency source for microwave electronics or as a sensitive probe of quantum mechanics by measuring the vacuum fluctuations of its own motion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A key requirement in many applications of quantum information science is the ability to generate and detect single photons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to achieve these goals it will be necessary to develop new technologies capable of generating and detecting individual quanta of light.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One promising approach involves coupling semiconductor nanocrystals (quantum dots) with optical cavities such as Fabry-Perot resonators1-5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These devices are expected to have important applications ranging from quantum optics6-8 to solid-state quantum computing9-11.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, one major challenge facing their development has been achieving sufficiently large Purcell factors12-14 so that spontaneous emission rates into the cavity mode become comparable to those observed in atomic systems15-17.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem may be overcome using photonic crystal cavities18-20 which allow for strong confinement of electromagnetic fields within small volumes21-23.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an explicit construction for a massive gauge theory with spontaneous symmetry breaking, which is based on the nonlinearly realized gauge group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model contains two scalar fields and one vector field in addition to the usual Higgs doublet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this model can be obtained by gauging the global SU(2)LxSU(2)R chiral symmetry of the Nambu-Jona-Lasinio (NJL) model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to obtain the correct vacuum structure we introduce additional interactions between the scalars and fermions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are motivated by the requirement that they should not change the physical spectrum but only modify the effective potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads us to consider four different types of interaction terms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By performing a mean-field analysis at zero temperature we find that our model has three phases depending on the values of the parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For small coupling constants there exists a phase where both symmetries remain unbroken.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the couplings become larger then either the left-handed or right-handed symmetry breaks spontaneously while the other remains intact.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally if all coupling constants are large enough then both symmetries break simultaneously.

 The present study investigates the structural properties in Early Modern English syntax by applying network analysis to data obtained through corpus linguistics techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that, in general terms, syntactic networks were characterized by high clustering coefficients and low average path lengths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it was shown how these two parameters can be used as indicators for identifying different types of syntactic structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, some possible applications of this approach are discussed.

 Keywords: Network Analysis; Corpus Linguistics; Syntactic Structures; Clustering Coefficients; Average Path Lengths.

 Turbulence plays a crucial role in many physical phenomena ranging from weather prediction to oceanic circulation and combustion processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite decades of research turbulence still remains one of the most challenging problems in computational fluid dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One reason of this difficulty is due to the wide range of length scales involved in turbulent flows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since large eddies contain most of the kinetic energy they only occupy a small fraction of the total volume.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the other hand smaller eddies fill up almost all space but contribute little to the overall kinetic energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, if one wants to resolve all relevant flow structures accurately enough then extremely fine grids would become needed leading to prohibitively expensive calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To overcome this problem so-called Large Eddy Simulations (LESs) were developed during the last two decades [1, 2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These techniques aim at resolving only those large-scale motions responsible for the bulk of the kinetic energy while modeling the effect of unresolved small-scale fluctuations using suitable closure relations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although LES has been successfully applied to various engineering problems [3–5] , it suffers from several drawbacks such as the lack of universality of the employed sub-grid scale models [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to detect the embedded watermark in the attacked image, we use a correlation detector with a threshold value that is determined adaptively according to the local statistics of each block.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an exact quantum-mechanical treatment for the dynamics of open systems in which the system is coupled to many harmonic oscillators representing its surrounding environment.

 We show that, under certain conditions, this model can be reduced exactly into a master equation with Lindblad form.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting master equations were used to study the effects of environmental fluctuations on the evolution of the density matrix describing the state of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Decoherence and relaxation processes play a crucial role for understanding the physics of open quantum systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These phenomena arise when the system interacts with some external degrees of freedom (environment) whose influence cannot be neglected [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there has been considerable interest in developing theoretical methods capable of treating these effects beyond the perturbative regime [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of approaches have been proposed ranging from phenomenological treatments based on stochastic Schrödinger equations [5] , to more microscopic descriptions using path integral techniques [6] or field-theoretical formulations [7, 8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite their successes, all these methods suffer from one common drawback: they may not provide any insight into the underlying physical mechanisms responsible for decoherence and relaxation; nor do they allow us to make quantitative predictions regarding the time scales involved [9] .

 [13] who showed that the statistical properties of macroscopic objects could be obtained by averaging over an ensemble of identical but microscopically distinct realizations of the same experiment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although ZPE cannot actually exist because it violates the laws of physics, it does provide useful insight into certain phenomena observed within our universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if we consider the expansion of space-time during the early stages of the universe's existence, then it seems reasonable to assume that the volume of space increased exponentially over time due to the rapid release of ZPE.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If so, then the total mass-energy density would decrease rapidly until all available ZPE had become released.

 At this stage, the universe will consist solely of vacuum fluctuations, i.e., virtual particles and antiparticles existing simultaneously but never interacting with each other.

 The question is not new, but it has was recently revived by the publication of two papers in Nature and Science that claim to show that biodiversity loss leads to ecosystem collapse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The authors argue that this finding should be taken seriously because ecosystems are essential for human well-being.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They also point out that there have been many previous studies showing that biodiversity loss can lead to declines in ecosystem functioning (e.g., productivity) without necessarily causing an abrupt change in state or collapse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we review these recent findings on biodiversity-ecosystem function relationships as well as some earlier results suggesting that biodiversity may sometimes enhance rather than reduce ecosystem stability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude with a discussion about how our understanding of biodiversity-ecosystem function interactions could be improved through further research.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Biodiversity loss is one of humanity's greatest challenges today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It threatens the sustainability of natural resources used directly by humans such as food production systems and water supply, and indirectly via changes in climate regulation and disease transmission pathways.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 There is growing concern over the rate at which species extinction rates are increasing globally due to anthropogenic activities including habitat destruction, pollution, overexploitation, and invasive alien species1–3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This situation has led to calls for urgent action to conserve biological diversity4–6.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite widespread recognition of the importance of conserving biodiversity7–10, there remains considerable uncertainty regarding its role in maintaining ecosystem functions11–13.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of theoretical models suggest that biodiversity loss will cause reductions in ecosystem functioning14–16.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, Tilman et al. (1997)17 showed theoretically that reducing plant species richness would decrease primary productivity in grassland communities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similarly, Naeem & Li (1998)18 found experimentally that removing species from soil microcosms reduced decomposition rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These predictions were supported by numerous subsequent empirical studies19–22.

 We introduce the notion for covering homology, which is an extension of ordinary homology to infinite graphs and simplicial complexes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first law of thermodynamics was usually presented as an assertion about entropy, but it can be derived in other ways.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The article presents one such derivation using statistical mechanics and information theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The result is that entropy was defined by the amount of uncertainty associated with a system's state (or lack thereof).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Entropy increases when there are more possible states for which we cannot predict what will happen to the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By this sense, entropy measures how much our knowledge decreases when we learn something new about the world around us.   .   .   .   .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second law of thermodynamics asserts that entropy always increases over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if you look closely at the definition of entropy given above, you'll see that it's not clear whether or not entropy actually does increase over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To answer this question, let's consider two different systems, A and B, both of which start out in equilibrium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 System A has only one possible configuration while system B has many possible configurations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If we were able to observe these systems, we'd find that they have exactly the same energy levels and temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 But now imagine that we're observing them through a tiny window so that we can't tell what's going on inside each system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We'd then conclude that system A looks like its temperature was higher than system B because there's less uncertainty about its future behavior.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Now suppose that we let system A evolve into system C, where all particles become arranged in perfect order.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then system C would appear colder than system A even though their energies remained unchanged.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 So far we've seen that entropy doesn't necessarily increase over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It can decrease instead.

 We study the evolutionarily stable strategy (ESS) and its stability properties for a class of ultimatum games with two-sided incomplete information, where one player is informed about his opponent's type while the other has no such information.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If this set contains unbounded elements then we prove that the ESS may be unstable under small perturbations of the payoff functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it can be shown that any ESS must satisfy certain conditions related to the distribution function of the types.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present some numerical examples illustrating our results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The evolutionary game theory studies how strategies evolve over time when players interact repeatedly within large populations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It provides a natural framework in analyzing strategic interactions between self-interested agents who are unable to commit themselves ex-ante but have the opportunity to learn by observing past play.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A typical example of such situation arises in bargaining problems where each agent makes offers sequentially without knowing what proposals will get made by their opponents.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem was first studied by Guth et al. (1982) , who introduced the so-called ultimatum game as a model of bargaining between two selfish individuals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this game, Player 1 proposes a division of a fixed amount of money M into shares x and y = M −x offered to himself and Player 2 respectively; Player 2 either accepts or rejects the offer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If he accepts, both players receive their respective shares according to the proposal; otherwise they get nothing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since the seminal work of Guth et al., many authors has investigated various aspects of the ultimatum game including existence and multiplicity of equilibria, efficiency loss due to lack of commitment power etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (see e.g. Binmore & Shaked, 1993; Ochs & Roth, 1989) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, all these works assume complete information about the players.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Introduction  Parallel computing can become increasingly important due to its ability to solve large problems faster than serial computers [2] , but it also presents new challenges related to the distribution of work among multiple processing units [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, these algorithms often require some form of data redistribution during their execution [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As example, consider a computation where each process stores part of a dataset (e.g., matrix)

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 However, they did not consider the possibility of having both types of fluxes simultaneously turned on.

 We show that, in addition to gravitational waves and neutrinos, there is an additional source of energy loss during the final stages of stellar evolution which has been largely ignored by previous authors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This arises because the universe becomes transparent to photons at redshifts z ~ 1100 (the time when matter-radiation equality occurs), allowing them to stream freely outwards into space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting decrease in pressure causes the universe to expand faster than it would otherwise do, thereby accelerating its expansion rate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We estimate this effect for different types of stars and find that it can be significant - up to 10% of the total luminosity output of massive stars may be lost due to this process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we predict that Type Ia supernovae should exhibit systematically lower peak luminosities compared with their observed values if they were not corrected for this effect.

 The recent detection of temperature anisotropies in the cosmic microwave background radiation (CMBR) have provided strong evidence for an early phase of accelerated expansion known as inflation [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it has been shown [2] that these observations are consistent with predictions based on slow-roll models [3] , where the energy density decreases slowly during inflation due to friction-like effects [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to explain why such a period of rapid expansion occurred, one usually invokes a scalar field called "inflaton" whose potential V(φ) drives inflation when it becomes flat enough [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there exists no compelling theoretical reason for choosing any particular form for V(φ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if we assume that V(φ) = m 2 φ 2 /2

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 This ambiguity leads us to consider more general forms for V(φ), including those containing higher-order terms [7, 8] .

 The multifractal nature of the human heartbeat has was studied by many authors, but most studies have focused on short time series (typically less than one hour).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we study the scaling properties in long-term recordings of the electrocardiograms (ECG) of healthy subjects during sleep using wavelet transforms to calculate the singularity spectrum f(α), which characterizes the degree of multifractality present in each signal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that all signals were characterized by a broad range of exponents α indicating strong multifractality.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The width Δα of these spectra decreases with increasing recording length T as Δα~T-1/2 for T10 hours.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This indicates that the ECGs become more monofractal-like when longer recordings were considered.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we show how our results can be used to detect pathological changes in the heart rate variability associated with congestive heart failure.

 Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) are promising materials for field emission devices due to their unique physical and chemical properties, such as high aspect ratio, low work function, and excellent mechanical strength.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experimental data show good agreement to simulated results obtained from the proposed model.

 Chemical systems often exhibit complex spatial structures such as stripes or rings which form spontaneously without any externally imposed symmetry breaking [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this case, the initial solution contains both cations (e.g., Ag+) and anions (e.g., Cl-).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When these two solutions come into contact, they begin to diffuse across each other till they meet another interface where the opposite charges neutralize one another [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From some point after mixing, precipitation occurs leading to the formation of a band of solid material separating the original solutions

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Introduction     Brain connectomics aims to map all neuronal elements into a single comprehensive description of the human brain

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite these advancements, there remains significant uncertainty regarding the precise nature of the relationships among neurons [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Then, we train a classifier to learn the mapping of node features and edge weights [16] .

 Finally, we apply the trained model with unseen test cases [17] to infer unknown interactions

 The aim of this thesis is the study and development of computational methods for prolongation structures, which are used as tools in geometric analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main focus lies on the construction of explicit formulas for the prolonged action of vector fields on tensor bundles over manifolds with symmetries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we consider Lie groups acting by diffeomorphisms on Riemannian or pseudo-Riemannian manifolds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an algorithm that computes the prolonged action on a given vector field on any tensor bundle associated to such a manifold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This algorithm relies on the use of invariant bases adapted to the symmetry group at hand.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As applications we compute the prolonged actions of some important examples like the Killing vector fields on homogeneous spaces and the conformal vector fields on conformally flat manifolds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we show how our results can be applied to construct new families of solutions to Einstein's equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that for all these three types of noise there is an optimal noise intensity at which the system undergoes a transition to a state where it performs better than without noise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The optimal noise intensities are different depending on whether we consider additive or multiplicative noise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, if the PSD has a peak around zero frequency then the optimal noise intensity decreases as the width of this peak increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the PSD does not have such a peak but decays monotonically towards zero frequencies then the optimal noise intensity increases as the decay rate becomes slower.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, if the PSD decays faster than exponentially then the optimal noise intensity remains constant irrespective of how fast the PSD decays.

 [2] , which describes bunching behavior for short times and anti-bunching at longer times [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 For example, in Ref.

 We have performed in-orbit focal adjustment (IFA) for the infrared camera onboard AKARI satellite using its own data taken in orbit.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The IFA is carried out by comparing the observed point spread function (PSF) and that simulated based on ray tracing analysis, which is one of the most accurate methods to determine the best focus position.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that the PSFs were not always consistent between different bands even after the IFA had been completed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This inconsistency may be caused by some errors in the optical design or manufacturing process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we also found that there are still some problems remaining in the calibration accuracy of the detector pixel size.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results could help us improve our understanding about the performance of the instrument as well as provide useful information for future space missions.

 We study the properties of Bose-Einstein condensates (BECs) with an arbitrary number N of particles trapped by a harmonic oscillator and exposed to a disordered external potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that, for any strength of disorder, there is always a finite fraction of atoms localized at each site of the lattice.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The localization length decreases as the disorder increases but remains macroscopic even when the disorder becomes very large compared to the interatomic interaction energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result holds true both in one dimension and higher dimensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we find that the critical disorder above which all states are localized scales like 1/N in 1D and 1/d in 2D and 3D where d is the spatial dimension.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results provide a microscopic understanding from recent experiments on ultracold atomic gases in optical lattices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These systems can be described theoretically using the framework of the Bose-Hubbard model [2] , which has been extensively studied over the past decade [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we consider the case of a gas of interacting bosons in a disordered potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Disorder leads towards Anderson localization

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, these experiments are performed only in the weak-disorder regime, i.e., when the disorder amplitude V0 is much smaller than the characteristic hopping matrix element J.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we investigate how the presence of interactions affects the physics of strongly disordered systems.

 We study the dynamics of random Boolean networks (RBNs) by analyzing their attractors and basins, which are determined by the network's state transition matrix.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the number of states in an RBN is bounded above by its average sensitivity (AS), defined as the expected Hamming distance between two randomly chosen nodes at time t+1 given they differed on one node at time t.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This bound can be used to estimate the size of the basin of attraction for any fixed point or cycle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we prove that if AS = 1 then there exists only one attractor with probability one.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present simulation results showing how our bounds compare against exact values obtained through exhaustive search over small networks.

 We present results from metal and molecular gas cooling in cosmological hydrodynamic simulations with the Enzo code, focusing on the effects of different numerical schemes for solving the energy equation (SPH vs. grid-based) as well as varying physical prescriptions for star formation feedback.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that SPH codes tend to overestimate the amount of cold gas at high redshifts compared to grid-based methods due to artificial viscosity heating.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Feedback models which include galactic winds are able to suppress this effect by removing low entropy material from galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we also show that these wind models can lead to an underestimation of the total mass fraction of cool gas if they remove too much hot halo gas around massive halos.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Overall our results suggest that current state-of-the-art galaxy formation models produce reasonable estimates for the global properties of the warm-hot intergalactic medium but might still be missing important physics related to the detailed distribution of metals within individual galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The lack of any spectral evolution across this break suggests it was caused by energy injection into the blast wave.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results are consistent with previous claims that achromatic breaks observed in many other bursts may be explained as being due to late-time energy injections rather than jet-break effects.

 We show how this approach can be used for extracting information about the phonon spectrum and the density of states of charge carriers from TSL data obtained on different types of materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study of luminescence phenomena has been attracting considerable attention over many years because it provides valuable information about electronic structure and optical properties of solids

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thermal stimulation luminescence (TSL), also known as optically stimulated luminescence (OSL), is particularly useful as it enables us to probe the distribution function of electrons excited into the conduction band

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent decades there have been numerous attempts to develop theoretical models describing various aspects of luminescence processes [3] , including thermal stimulation luminescence

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most of these works are based on the assumption that the system under consideration is always close to equilibrium

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result they cannot describe correctly some important features observed experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the shape of the TSL glow curve depends strongly on the type of material [11] : while in insulators it usually exhibits a single peak [12] , in metals it often consists of several peaks [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, even within the same class of materials, e.g., semiconductor crystals [14] , the number of peaks can vary depending on the doping level [15] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These observations cannot be explained using existing theories

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The universe is expanding at an accelerating rate, which has been attributed to "dark energy".

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article reviews the current status in research into dark energy by examining some recent observational results in this area.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The author concludes that there are still many open questions about how best to explain these observations within general relativity theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it remains unclear whether or not the observed acceleration can been explained as being due solely to gravitational effects associated with the presence of dark energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also appears likely that new physics will need to be introduced if we wish to understand why the expansion of space-time should accelerate rather than decelerate over time.

 The universe is expanding at an accelerated rate, which has become interpreted as evidence for the existence of "dark energy" (DE).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article examines some recent observational results on DE using supernovae Ia data, cosmic microwave background radiation measurements, baryon acoustic oscillations, galaxy cluster counts, weak lensing surveys, and Hubble parameter determinations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SED is modeled with an accretion disk, synchrotron emission from relativistic electrons in jets, inverse Compton scattering off soft photons produced within the jet or external to it, and thermal radiation from dusty clouds surrounding the central engine.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we cannot explain why there are two peaks in the UV spectrum at ~1400 Å and ~1900 Å simultaneously.

 We show that the observed value of the cosmological constant is systematically affected by the presence of matter around us, and we calculate this effect for different models of dark energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the correction can be significant (up to 30%) if one assumes that the universe has an average density equal to the critical density today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The correction becomes smaller when the universe is less dense than the critical density or more negative pressure is assumed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This systematic error may explain why the current measurements are not consistent with each other within their errors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it may also affect future experiments aimed at measuring the time evolution of the cosmological constant.

 The idea that the universe underwent an inflationary phase at very early times is now widely accepted by cosmologists as one possible explanation for many observed features of our present-day universe, such as its flatness and homogeneity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will discuss how string-theoretic ideas can been used to construct models of inflation which are consistent with current observations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The basic idea behind these constructions is that they involve branes moving through extra dimensions of space-time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These branes will either move towards each other or away from each other depending on their initial conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If two branes collide then it leads to a rapid expansion of spacetime known as "inflation".

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process continues as the branes separate again and the universe reverts back to its original size.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As well as discussing some recent results obtained using these techniques, I will also describe some open problems associated with them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, I will briefly mention another approach to constructing realistic models of inflation based upon so-called "brane-world scenarios".

 We first derive an upper bound on DMT by using the cut-set theorem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, depending on the derived upper bound, we propose two schemes to achieve the optimal DMT performance in different scenarios.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, when all relays have full-duplex capability, our proposed scheme achieves the optimal DMT at high multiplexing gain region; whereas if only half-duplex relays are available, then our proposed scheme can still achieve the optimal DMT except that it is achieved at low multiplexing gain region instead.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, simulation results show that both proposed schemes outperform existing ones significantly.

 We study patterns in global economic activity by analyzing the World Trade Web (WTW), which is an interconnected network that represents international transactions between countries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We study the generation of large-scale magnetic fields in astrophysical plasmas with very small values of the magnetic Prandtl number, Pm = ν/η ≪ 1 (ν is viscosity, η is resistivity).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider two different types for flows that are relevant for this problem -helically driven turbulence and convection-driven turbulence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here U , L, and Rm are characteristic velocity, length, and magnetic field scales respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For helically driven turbulence these contributions can be grouped into three categories:  The first category includes all terms proportional to Re(Rm)−1/2 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The author presents an alternative approach to teaching special relativity by using the concept of transformation groups and their generators, which is used in physics for describing symmetry properties of physical systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 In this work, we propose cooperative transmission protocols for wireless networks using multiuser detection (MUD) at the relay node to improve spectral efficiency as well as diversity order.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, they also demonstrate that the performance gap between the two considered cooperative schemes is negligible when the number of transmit antennas increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Kondo necklace model 1 ,2 describes a chain with magnetic impurities coupled via antiferromagnetic exchange interactions J.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has was introduced originally for describing the physics of heavy fermion compounds 3 but it also appears naturally in other contexts 4-7 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the present work we consider the case when the coupling constant J exceeds some critical value

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Jc = 2t / U where t denotes hopping amplitude between neighboring sites and U stands for local Coulomb repulsion energy 8-10 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Below zero temperature the ground state of the system corresponds then to a ferromagnetically ordered state 11-13 while at finite temperatures one expects a continuous quantum phase transition into a paramagnetic state 14-17 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This transition occurs due to strong spin fluctuations 18-20 and belongs therefore to the same universality class as the Heisenberg chain 21-23 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However there are important differences between both models 24-26 : First, the Kondo necklace contains two types of excitations -spinons and holons 27-29 -while the Heisenberg chain only consists of spin-1/2 particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Second, the Kondo necklaces contain additional degrees of freedom associated with charge carriers 30-32 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These features lead into new phenomena not observed in the Heisenberg chain 33-36 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the Kondo necklacelike systems may exhibit unconventional superconducting states 37-39 .

 It can be downloaded from: http://arxiv.org/abs/physics/9701001v1.pdf  In order to teach physics effectively, one must first have a clear understanding of what constitutes good thinking within the subject area.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unfortunately, many people who are not trained scientists may not think like physicists; they tend to make mistakes which often lead them astray.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if asked whether two objects will fall together towards earth's center of mass, most people would say no because they believe that gravity acts only between bodies that touch each other.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, according to Newtonian mechanics, gravitational attraction will act upon all matter regardless of its position relative to another body.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If you were to ask someone else why two objects don't fall together, she might answer that they are connected by a string so their weight cancels out.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although this explanation seems reasonable, it fails to take into account the fact that the force exerted by the string is negligible compared to the forces acting upon both objects individually.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a result, her reasoning is flawed.

 The distance geometry problem is the following: given n points in space, find their coordinates such as they are as close to each other as possible while respecting some constraints on distances between pairs of points.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we consider an application of the distance geometry problem to music analysis and propose a novel method for automatic transcription of musical scores into symbolic representations based on the concept of pitch class profiles (PCP).

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate our algorithm's performance in several classical piano pieces.

 It consists of recovering the underlying harmonic structure of a piece of music from its audio signal or MIDI file.

 1 Introduction Stellar ages play a crucial role in many areas of astrophysics ranging from Galactic archaeology to exoplanet science.

 In particular, accurate ages were needed to understand how planets form and evolve over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, other approaches must been explored to determine ages for large samples of stars spanning different stages of evolution.

 Gyrochronology provides another avenue for estimating ages based on the spin-down rate of magnetic activity cycles driven by dynamo processes operating at the base of the solar convective zone (Barnes 2003) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, this task has been made more difficult due to the large number of false positives produced by systematic noise sources such as instrumental artifacts and astrophysical phenomena like eclipsing binaries and pulsating stars.

 Introduction     It has been known since the work by Wannier [1] that the ground states of the spin-1/2 Heisenberg antiferromagnet on an infinite square lattice are infinitely degenerate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, this fact does not necessarily mean that all possible configurations can appear as ground states [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the ground states of the one-dimensional chain are unique although its energy spectrum is continuous [3] , while those of the two-dimensional triangular-lattice Heisenberg antiferromagnet are doubly degenerate [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, several authors studied the ground states in the two-dimensional anisotropic nearest neighbor Ising model (AN-NNI)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They showed numerically that the ground states are infinitely degenerate on the square lattices if J 1 = J 2 or J 1 < J 2

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, the ground states are shown to be unique on the honeycomb lattice [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that the ground states might be nondegenerate even though their exact forms remain unknown so far.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this Letter, we investigate the ground states of the ANNNI model using Monte Carlo simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, we confirm whether the ground states are indeed infinitely degenerate on the squarelattice ANNNI models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, we examine if these ground states are unique or not.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how the ground states change based on the values of J 1 / J 2 .

 We report on the observation of strong electron-phonon interaction (EPI) in heavily boron-doped epitaxial graphene grown on SiC(0001).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The EPI was found to be enhanced by more than one order of magnitude compared with that observed for undoped graphene, which can be attributed to the formation of a Dirac point at high doping levels and its associated van Hove singularity near the Fermi level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This finding suggests that the EPI in doped graphene may be tunable over several orders of magnitude through chemical or electrostatic gating.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Graphene has attracted considerable attention because it exhibits unique physical properties such as extremely high carrier mobility1-5 and very large optical nonlinearities6-8.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, these remarkable properties are often accompanied by weak interactions between electrons and phonons9-11, which limit their applications in high-speed electronics12-14 and optoelectronics15-17.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Graphene is known to have extremely high carrier mobilities1-4 but relatively small electron-phonon couplings5-9.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Quantum information processing requires scalable systems based on many qubits [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present new exact solutions to the Einstein field equations for stationary axisymmetric spacetimes with two commuting Killing vectors, which are generated by applying nonholonomic frame transforms (NFT) to known vacuum solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study of exact solutions to the Einstein equations has played a crucial role in understanding many aspects of general relativity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it is often difficult to construct such solutions as they require solving complicated nonlinear partial differential equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem becomes even more challenging when considering physically interesting situations like those involving rotation and/or matter fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Nevertheless, there exist several techniques that allow one to generate new classes of solutions starting from simpler ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of the most powerful methods involves transforming the original solution into another one via so-called nonholonomic frame transforms [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such transformations preserve certain geometric properties of the spacetime while changing others; see [2] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [4] for reviews.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, since the transformed solution satisfies the vacuum Einstein equations then so does the original one [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this work we apply nonholonomic frame transforms to known vacuum solutions of the Einstein equations in order to generate new exact solutions describing stationary axisymmetric spacetimes: i.e., spacetimes admitting at least two independent Killing vector fields whose orbits are closed curves [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Stationary axisymmetric spacetimes play an important role in astrophysics because they describe the exterior gravitational field of spinning objects like stars, planets, and black holes

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this method can been used for both bosonic and fermionic systems with attractive interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed scheme has several advantages against other methods such as evaporative cooling or sympathetic cooling.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It did not require any additional laser beams besides those needed for trapping and manipulating cold atoms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition it works even when there are no free particles present initially (e.g., at zero temperature).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we discuss how our proposal could be realized experimentally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
